oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: 01_Oceanic Travels of Mother Cabrini
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cabrini, Frances Xavier, Saint, 1850-1917; Voyages and travels;
Cabrini, Frances Xavier, Saint, 1850-1917; Voyages and travels; oceanic travels;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A timeline summarizing the principal journeys of Mother Cabrini between 1889-1917. In 28 years Mother Cabrini spent 9 months on oceanic voyages, 13 years in the United States, 11 years and 7 months in Europe and 3 years and 3 months in Latin America. All this from a woman who, after a near fatal drowning as a young girl, was deathly afraid of water. World War I prohibited Mother Cabrini from travelling to Europe. She spent the last five years of her life in the United States. Image from: "Mother Cabrini Italian Immigrant of the Century." Mary Louise Sullivan, MSC. NY; Center for Migration Studies, 1992.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sullivan, Mary Louise, M.S.C.
